newsitem.title: DUBAI: UAE stocks unmoved, but selling pressure seen.
newsitem.headline: UAE stocks unmoved, but selling pressure seen.

text.p: United Arab Emirates shares resisted a wave of selling pressure in the week to Thursday to end without any significant price changes, brokers said.
They said buying interest remained low for the second week running as most investors focused their demand on a 209 million dirham public offering by a new UAE insurance firm.
"Subscription in Al-Khazna Insurance Company which started on Tuesday was the centre of attention," one broker said.

He said small investors resorted to selling some recently- acquired shares as the 12-day subscription period was too short for them to arrange alternative funding to buy into the new flotation. But shares managed to hold recent levels.
Dubai Investment Co (DIC) was the exception, with its share price ending half a dirham lower at 12.5 dirhams.
The unofficial National Bank of Abu Dhabi 27-share index ended the week fractionally lower at 2,333.02 points from 2,335.06 the previous week.
